welcome.createDescription: Your data will be stored locally in your browser.
welcome.skipEncryptionDescription: Your data will be stored in plaintext. You can add encryption later.
welcome.warningNoEncryptionDescription: Your data will be stored without encryption. Anyone with access to your browser storage can read it. It is strongly recommended to add encryption from the settings after setup.
welcome.confirmDemoDescription: This will create a binder pre-filled with example data for testing. You can edit or delete this data later.
welcome.confirmDemoHint: Make sure you've entered a passphrase above, then click "Load Demo Data" again to confirm.
welcome.importantNoteText: Your passphrase cannot be recovered if lost. Store it securely.
welcome.unlockDescription: Enter your passphrase to access your encrypted data.
welcome.unlockDescriptionNoEncryption: Your binder is not encrypted. Click unlock to access your data.
welcome.warningUnlockNoEncryptionDescription: Your data is not encrypted. Consider adding encryption from the settings after unlocking.
welcome.localStorageNote: Your data is encrypted and stored locally in your browser.
welcome.noServerNote: No data is sent to any server.
welcome.errorPassphraseTooShort: Passphrase must be at least 8 characters
welcome.errorPassphraseWithSkipEncryption: Cannot set passphrase when skipping encryption. Clear passphrase or uncheck "Skip encryption".
welcome.errorDemoPassphraseTooShort: Passphrase must be at least 8 characters for demo data

contacts.updateReferencesFirst: If you delete this contact, these references will become invalid. Consider updating them first.

help.title: Help & Guide
help.description: Everything you need to know about using Life Binder effectively
help.needMoreHelpText: Life Binder is designed to be intuitive, but everyone's situation is unique. Take your time exploring each module and don't hesitate to use the notes fields for information that doesn't fit standard categories. Remember: the best Life Binder is one that's started, even if it's not perfect.

whatIs.title: What is Life Binder?
whatIs.description: Life Binder is a secure, client-side application designed to help you organize and document critical information for end-of-life planning. It ensures your loved ones have access to everything they need when the time comes.
whatIs.why1: Organize passwords, accounts, and important documents in one secure place
whatIs.why2: Create a clear notification plan so the right people are informed
whatIs.why3: Document estate details, assets, and beneficiaries
whatIs.why4: Prepare emergency information for your family
whatIs.why5: Export everything to encrypted files or PDFs for safekeeping
whatIs.closing: All your data is stored locally in your browser or can be encrypted and exported. Nothing is sent to external servers unless you choose to back it up.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.creatingPlan1: From the welcome screen, choose to create a new plan or explore with demo data
gettingStarted.creatingPlan2: If using demo data, review the examples to understand each section
gettingStarted.creatingPlan3: Replace demo data with your real information when ready
gettingStarted.creatingPlan4: Use the "Reset Plan" button to start fresh if needed
gettingStarted.securityText: We strongly recommend adding encryption immediately after creating your plan. Go to Settings â†’ Add Encryption to protect your data with a passphrase. Store this passphrase securely - it cannot be recovered if lost.
gettingStarted.autoLockDescription: Life Binder automatically locks after a period of inactivity (default: 30 minutes). You can adjust this in Settings. When locked:
gettingStarted.autoLock1: Encrypted plans require your passphrase to unlock
gettingStarted.autoLock3: You'll see a warning before auto-lock occurs

dashboard.title: Dashboard Module
dashboard.description: The Dashboard provides an at-a-glance view of your Life Binder's completeness and guides you on what to fill out next.
dashboard.completenessDescription: Each section shows a percentage based on:
dashboard.completeness2: Notification Plan: Primary and secondary contacts assigned
dashboard.completeness3: Access: Password managers and email accounts documented
dashboard.completeness6: Estate Planning: Executor and attorney information provided
dashboard.completeness7: Emergency: Meeting locations and emergency contacts added
dashboard.quickTipText: Don't worry about achieving 100% completion. Focus on the sections most relevant to your situation. The dashboard helps identify gaps but isn't meant to be a checklist.

contacts.title: Contacts Module
contacts.description: Contacts are the people who matter most in your life - those who should be notified and who might need access to your information.
contacts.include1: Name and relationship: Make it clear who this person is
contacts.include2: Multiple contact methods: Phone and email when possible
contacts.include3: Physical address: Especially for legal or estate matters
contacts.include4: Notes: Any context your other contacts might need
contacts.notificationDescription: After adding contacts, assign them to notification tiers in the Access module. This creates a clear chain of communication:
contacts.notification1: Primary: First person to be notified (executor, spouse, etc.)
contacts.notification2: Secondary: Notified if primary is unavailable

access.title: Access Module
access.description: The Access module is the heart of Life Binder - it documents how to access your digital life and who should be notified when the time comes.
access.passwordManagersDescription: Document your password manager details (LastPass, 1Password, Bitwarden, etc.):
access.passwordManagers1: Master password location or recovery instructions
access.emailAccountsDescription: Primary email accounts are gateways to everything else. Document:
access.securityNoteText: This is highly sensitive information. Always enable encryption and use a strong passphrase. Consider storing master passwords separately and referencing their location here instead.

accounts.title: Accounts Module
accounts.description: Track subscriptions, services, and online accounts that need to be managed or canceled.
accounts.bestPracticeText: Include account URLs, usernames, and renewal dates. For accounts with ongoing costs, note whether they should be canceled or maintained.

documents.title: Documents Module
documents.description: Track physical and digital documents that your loved ones will need to locate.
documents.legalText: Birth certificate, marriage license, passport, social security card, driver's license
documents.financialText: Tax returns, bank statements, investment accounts, retirement accounts, life insurance policies
documents.propertyText: Deeds, titles, mortgage papers, rental agreements, vehicle titles
documents.medicalText: Medical records, prescriptions, advance directives, living will, DNR orders
documents.locationsText: For each document, specify exactly where it can be found: safe deposit box number and bank, home safe location, filing cabinet drawer, cloud storage path, or attorney's office.

estate.title: Estate Planning Module
estate.description: Document your estate plan, asset distribution wishes, and end-of-life preferences.
estate.keyInfo1: Executor: The person responsible for carrying out your will
estate.keyInfo2: Will & Trust Locations: Where these documents are stored
estate.keyInfo3: Attorney & Accountant: Professional contacts for estate matters
estate.keyInfo4: Assets: Property, investments, valuables with distribution instructions
estate.keyInfo5: Beneficiaries: Who receives what, with percentage allocations
estate.distributionDescription: For each asset, choose how to document distribution:
estate.distribution1: Simple: Quick text description (e.g., "Split equally among children")
estate.distribution2: Structured: Detailed breakdown with percentages per beneficiary
estate.funeralText: Document your wishes for burial or cremation, service preferences, memorial donations, and any specific instructions for your loved ones.
estate.legalReminderText: Life Binder is not a legal document and doesn't replace a properly executed will. Use it to document and communicate your wishes, but ensure legal documents are filed appropriately.

emergency.title: Emergency Module
emergency.description: Prepare your family for emergencies with meeting locations, evacuation plans, and critical information.
emergency.meetingLocationsDescription: Designate places where family should meet if separated during an emergency:
emergency.meetingLocations1: Primary: Nearby location (e.g., neighbor's house, park)
emergency.utilityShutoffsText: Document how to shut off gas, water, and electricity in case of emergency. Include valve locations, required tools, and any special instructions.
emergency.grabListDescription: Items to grab if you need to evacuate quickly. Assign priorities (1 = highest):
emergency.emergencyContactsText: List local emergency contacts beyond 911: doctors, veterinarians, insurance agents, utility companies, and neighbors who can help.

exportModule.title: Export Module
exportModule.description: Export your Life Binder as a PDF or encrypted backup file to store securely or share with trusted contacts.
exportModule.pdfDescription: Creates a comprehensive PDF document with all your information formatted for easy reading. Perfect for:
exportModule.pdf1: Printing and storing in a safe location
exportModule.pdf2: Sharing with your executor or family
exportModule.encryptedDescription: Exports your entire plan as an encrypted JSON file. This is your digital backup:
exportModule.encrypted1: Can be imported back into Life Binder later
exportModule.encrypted2: Encrypted with your passphrase (if encryption is enabled)
exportModule.encrypted4: Store in cloud storage or external drive
exportModule.backupStrategyText: Export regularly and store backups in multiple locations: one with your executor, one in a safe deposit box, and one in secure cloud storage. Update whenever you make significant changes.

security.title: Security & Privacy
security.protectedDescription: Life Binder is designed with privacy and security as top priorities:
security.protected1: Client-Side Storage: All data is stored locally in your browser (unless you choose Supabase)
security.protected2: No Cloud Sync: Nothing is automatically uploaded to external servers
security.protected3: Encryption: Optional AES-256 encryption with your chosen passphrase
security.protected4: Auto-Lock: Automatically locks after inactivity to prevent unauthorized access
security.encryption1: Your data is encrypted with AES-256 before being stored
security.encryption2: Only your passphrase can decrypt it
security.encryption3: Even if someone accesses your browser, they can't read your data
security.encryption4: Your passphrase is never stored - only you know it
security.passphraseRecoveryText: If you lose your passphrase, your data CANNOT be recovered. There is no "forgot password" option. Write down your passphrase and store it in a secure location your executor can access.
security.sensitivityDescription: Some modules (like Estate Planning and Access) allow you to mark data as "High Sensitivity":
security.sensitivity1: Visual warning reminders about the sensitive nature
security.sensitivity2: Helps you remember to be extra careful with this information
security.sensitivity3: Consider additional security measures for high-sensitivity data

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
bestPractices.updates1: Annually: Review all information for accuracy
bestPractices.updates2: After major life events: Marriage, divorce, birth, death, moving
bestPractices.updates3: After password changes: Update access information immediately
bestPractices.updates4: After new accounts: Add subscriptions and services as you create them
bestPractices.sharingDescription: Think carefully about who should have access:
bestPractices.sharing1: Your Executor: Should have full access or know where to find your Life Binder
bestPractices.sharing2: Trusted Family: May need PDF exports of relevant sections
bestPractices.sharing3: Attorney: Consider sharing estate planning sections
bestPractices.sharing4: Digital Heir: Someone tech-savvy to handle online accounts
bestPractices.communicationText: Tell your executor where your Life Binder backup is stored and provide them with your passphrase in a secure manner (sealed envelope, password manager emergency access, etc.).
bestPractices.incrementalText: Don't try to complete everything at once. Start with the most critical information (contacts, notification plan, password manager access) and build from there. Even a partially completed Life Binder is valuable.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.dataA: Your data stays on your device unless you export it. By default, it's stored in your browser's localStorage. If you choose to use Supabase storage, you control that instance.
faq.multipleDevicesQ: Can I use Life Binder on multiple devices?
faq.multipleDevicesA: Life Binder stores data locally per device. To sync across devices, export from one device and import to another, or use cloud storage for your exported backups.
faq.legallyBindingA: No. Life Binder is a personal organizational tool, not a legal document. Always work with an attorney for legally binding wills, trusts, and estate documents.
faq.clearBrowserQ: What if I clear my browser data?
faq.clearBrowserA: If you clear browser storage, your Life Binder data will be deleted. This is why regular encrypted exports are crucial - they allow you to restore your data.
faq.passwordsA: For highly sensitive passwords (like your master password), consider storing them separately and referencing their location in Life Binder. For less critical passwords, encryption provides strong protection.
faq.percentageQ: How do I know what percentage complete is "enough"?
faq.percentageA: There's no magic number. Focus on documenting what matters most to your situation. If you live alone, emergency contacts might be more important than estate details. Tailor it to your needs.
faq.customizeQ: Can I customize categories or add custom fields?
faq.customizeA: Currently, Life Binder has fixed categories, but most sections have notes fields for additional information. Use these for custom details that don't fit standard fields.
faq.contactsDifferenceQ: What's the difference between Contacts and Emergency Contacts?
faq.contactsDifferenceA: Contacts are people in your life (family, friends, professionals). Emergency Contacts in the Emergency module are specific to disaster scenarios (e.g., neighbors, local services). There may be overlap.

access.title: Access Information
access.description: Document where to find passwords and how to access accounts
access.securityNoticeText: Avoid storing master passwords, PINs, or safe combinations here. Instead, note WHERE they can be found (e.g., "Master password stored in KeePass vault on desktop").
access.passwordManagerPlaceholder: e.g., KeePass vault on desktop computer. Key file on USB drive in safe. Master password with attorney.
access.passwordManagerHelpText: Describe where your password manager is and how to access it
access.twoFAPlaceholder: e.g., 2FA recovery codes in password manager. Authenticator app backup on secondary phone. SMS fallback to +1234567890.
access.twoFAHelpText: Explain how to recover 2FA codes or access accounts with 2FA
access.networkDescription: Router, modem, WiFi, and network access information
access.iotDescription: Smart home devices, hubs, and IoT equipment that may need special handling
access.deviceRetentionDescription: Important devices to keep and for how long (phones, laptops, tablets with saved passwords or 2FA apps)

fields.intendedRecipientPlaceholder: e.g., John Smith, Donate to charity
fields.disposalInstructionsPlaceholder: Special handling instructions for disposing or transferring this device
fields.requiresDataWipeHelp: Check if this device should be securely wiped before transfer or disposal
fields.retentionNotesPlaceholder: e.g., Keep for at least 1 year - has authenticator app with 2FA codes
fields.restartProceduresPlaceholder: Steps to restart or reset the network equipment
fields.recipientDispositionPlaceholder: Who should receive this device or how to dispose of it

securityRecovery.title: Security Recovery
securityRecovery.description: Account recovery security questions and answers
securityRecovery.highSensitivityText: This information can be used to access your accounts. Store this section securely and consider excluding it from exports shared with others.
securityRecovery.securityQuestionsDescription: Document security questions and answers used for account recovery

fields.questionPlaceholder: e.g., What is your mother's maiden name?

physicalSecurity.title: Physical Security
physicalSecurity.description: Document safes, cabinets, security systems, and keys

fields.combinationPlaceholder: How to access (don't store actual combination)
fields.codePlaceholder: Access code or where it's stored
fields.resetInstructionsPlaceholder: How to reset or change the code
fields.keyTypePlaceholder: e.g., House Key, Car Key, Safety Deposit Box
fields.opensWhatPlaceholder: What does this key open or unlock?

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: Manage your Life Binder preferences and security
settings.encryptionEnabledDesc: Your data is encrypted and protected with a passphrase. Your data is secured with client-side encryption.
settings.encryptionDisabledDesc: Your data is currently stored without encryption. Enable encryption to secure your sensitive information.
settings.createPassphrase: Create a strong passphrase to encrypt your data. You'll need this passphrase every time you access your Life Binder.
settings.passphraseMinLength: Passphrase must be at least 8 characters
settings.encryptionError: Failed to enable encryption. Please try again.
settings.showEncryptionWarningDesc: Display a warning banner when encryption is disabled
settings.aboutDescription: Life Binder is an open-source project. Check out the code, contribute, or show your support!
settings.viewOnGitHubDesc: Star the repo, report issues, or contribute
settings.dangerZoneDesc: Permanently delete this plan and all its data. This action cannot be undone. Make sure to export your data first if you need to keep it.
settings.deletePlanConfirm: Are you sure you want to permanently delete all your data? This action cannot be undone.
settings.passphraseWarning: Important: If you forget your passphrase, your data cannot be recovered. Store it securely.
settings.addEncryptionModalDesc: Adding encryption will secure your data with a passphrase. Once encrypted, you'll need to enter your passphrase each time you unlock the binder.
settings.encryptionWarningBanner: Your data is not encrypted! Anyone with access to your browser storage can read your data. Go to Settings to enable encryption.
settings.deleteFinalWarning: This action cannot be undone. Make sure you have exported your data if you need to keep it.
settings.resetPlanDescription: This will permanently delete all your data and return you to the welcome screen. You will need to create a new plan or import an existing one.

export.title: Export & Backup
export.description: Export your plan as PDF or create encrypted backups
export.pdfDescription: Generate a complete PDF document of your entire Life Binder plan. Perfect for printing or offline viewing.
export.pdfWarningText: The PDF export is not encrypted. Store it securely and consider excluding sensitive sections before export.
export.encryptedDescription: Create an encrypted backup of your entire plan that can be imported later. Protects your data with a passphrase.
export.importDescription: Restore your plan from a previously exported encrypted backup file.
export.exportInfo: Your backup will be encrypted with AES-256-GCM encryption using the passphrase you provide. Store this passphrase securely - you'll need it to import the backup.
export.passphraseHelp: Use a strong, unique passphrase. You'll need this exact passphrase to import this backup.
export.importWarningText: Importing will replace your current plan with the backup data. Make sure you have a backup of your current plan if needed.
export.importFailed: Import failed. Please check the file and passphrase.
export.includeItem3: Access information (emails, password manager location, 2FA notes)
export.encryptedFileWarningText: The exported file is encrypted with a passphrase. You can use the same passphrase as your main binder or create a different one for additional security.
export.importWarningTextShort: Importing will replace your current plan with the backup. Make sure to export your current plan first if needed.
export.replaceConfirm: This will replace your current plan. Are you sure?

errors.importFileMissing: Please select a file and enter the passphrase
errors.invalidBackupFormat: Invalid backup file format. This does not appear to be a valid Life Binder backup.
errors.invalidJSON: Invalid JSON file. The file appears to be corrupted or not a valid backup.
errors.importError: Failed to import. Check your passphrase and try again.

modal.exportDescription: Enter a passphrase to encrypt the backup. You'll need this passphrase to import the backup later.
modal.exportPassphraseHelp: Can be the same or different from your main binder passphrase
modal.importWarningText: This will replace your current plan. This action cannot be undone.

recommendations.title: Backup Recommendations
recommendations.item1: Export encrypted backups regularly (at least monthly)
recommendations.item2: Store backups in multiple secure locations (cloud storage, USB drive, etc.)
recommendations.item3: Generate PDF exports to share with trusted individuals
recommendations.item4: Keep your passphrases secure and accessible to trusted contacts
recommendations.item5: Review and update your binder after major life changes

willTestaments.title: Will & Testaments
willTestaments.description: Manage wills, trusts, assets, beneficiaries, and testament instructions
willTestaments.highSensitivityText: This information contains extra sensitive will and testament details.
willTestaments.normalSensitivityText: Standard protection for will and testament information.
willTestaments.willLocationPlaceholder: e.g., Safe deposit box, attorney's office
willTestaments.estateContactsDescription: Add contacts related to your estate plan
willTestaments.beneficiariesDescription: Beneficiaries, trustees, or other estate-related contacts. You can link existing contacts or create new ones.
willTestaments.assetsDescription: Add assets and specify how they should be distributed
willTestaments.assetsDescriptionFull: Track your assets and how they should be distributed. Choose between simple text descriptions or detailed beneficiary breakdowns.
willTestaments.specialInstructionsPlaceholder: Pet care, specific wishes, memorial preferences, etc.
willTestaments.generalNotesPlaceholder: Any other will and testament information
willTestaments.name: Name
willTestaments.distributionInstructionsPlaceholder: Describe how this asset should be distributed...
